title: R40521
content: The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) is a federal statute that provides funding for special education and related services. It requires states to offer a free appropriate public education (FAPE) to children with disabilities aged 3 to 21, identify and evaluate all children with disabilities, and create individual education programs (IEPs) for those receiving services. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) ensures that children with disabilities receive special education and related services through individual education programs (IEPs). Parents are involved in planning and overseeing their child's education as part of the IEP team. IDEA also mandates that children with disabilities be educated alongside non-disabled peers whenever possible, and provides procedural safeguards such as due process hearings and the right to appeal to federal court. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) ensures that children with disabilities receive special education and related services through individual education programs (IEPs).
